hints.content:
There are $\greenD{25}$ books in $\blueD5$ equal rows.

![Same image with the rows numbered 1 through 5 and horizontal lines between the rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4da0e35432982cdbafc93b77781b115d508ca8ac)

How can we find out how many books are in each row?

We can find how many books are in each row by dividing:

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of rows}}$

So, $\greenD{25}\div\blueD{5}$

The following expression will tell us how many books are in each row:

- $\greenD{25}\div\blueD5$

question.content:
There are $5$ equal rows of books. There are $25$ total books.

![25 books in 5 equal rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b6b98282acb82b9d8c58642fcea595fa46ad7b60) 

**Which expression will tell us how many books are in each row?**
